definition: to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: Somebody speaks little but he knows how to act according to the circumstances or to make use of opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 有些人惜口如金，却知趁势而为，见机行动。

sentences.english: Kids taking advantage of popular colors, can guide the consumer market.
sentences.chinese: 研究童装色彩流行趁势，可以指导消费市场。

sentences.english: He dribbled past the fullback and scored a goal.
sentences.chinese: 他越过对方后卫，趁势把球踢入球门。

sentences.english: Seizing the moment, Alexander signals his troops to turn and charge straight at Darius.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大趁势示意军队转而直功大流士。
